headline.main: Diabetes: Faces of an Epidemic; Type 1: The Morning I Will Never Remember

docs.abstract: Article by novelist Anne Rice recalls her unuspecting development of type 1 diabetes, which was only diagnosed when she collapsed into coma and almost died; describes her life today, with weight loss and diet modification; photos (special section, Women's Health) (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: IT began in early summer with indigestion. White-knuckle cramps after meals and dashes to the restroom. When it didn't pass, the family doctor recommended a drugstore remedy. I gobbled the chalky-tasting tablets. They didn't work. But I'd been through periods of this before, and I didn't really pay much attention to it. I had a book to write and was ahead of the game, and the summer was drowsy and green as always, and we were going out often to lunch. ''The livin' was easy.'' More time passed. The pain was predictable and brief but bad. I thought it prudent to check for pernicious anemia. My dad had had that curious malady. But the test came back negative.

docs.lead_paragraph: A selective listing by critics of The Times: New or noteworthy movies playing this weekend in New York City. * denotes a highly recommended film. Ratings and running times are in parentheses. Now Playing * ''CARANDIRU,'' starring Luiz Carlos Vasconcelos. Directed by Hector Babenco. (R, 146 minutes; in Portuguese, with English subtitles). The human life teeming through this sprawling portrait of Brazil's criminal class crowded within a notorious penitentiary exudes a throbbing flesh-and-blood intensity that's so compelling it's impossible to avert your eyes. Watching this messy epic is a little like being jammed into an un-air-conditioned subway car on a steamy summer night as it rattles through an urban wasteland: at any second, things could explode. And eventually they do. It is the 1980's, and the setting is São Paulo's real-life house of detention, which was torn down in 2002, a decade after a riot led to the massacre of 111 inmates by the police. The film is a splashy return to form by the celebrated director of ''Pixote'' and ''Kiss of the Spider Woman.'' In examining social ills, it interweaves multiple stories of the prisoners' lives as viewed by a doctor volunteering his services. Below its documentarylike sprawl, ''Carandiru'' is a hands-on movie passionately engaged in its characters' personal dramas. Just when it threatens to go soft, it erupts in what may be the most horrific prison riot ever filmed (Stephen Holden).

headline.main: KRAFT DROPS ITS PLAN TO REDUCE SOME PORTION SIZES

docs.abstract: Kraft Foods Inc abandons plans to reduce some portion sizes, citing consumer research showing shoppers prefer to have choice; discloses decision in progress report on anti-obesity initiatives announced last July (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Kraft Foods Inc. has abandoned its plan to reduce some portion sizes, citing consumer research that shows shoppers prefer to have a choice. Kraft disclosed the decision in a progress report on the anti-obesity initiatives it announced last July. With the food industry facing growing consumer health concerns and the risk of lawsuits, Kraft said last July that it would change some product recipes, reduce portions in some single-serve packages, quit marketing snacks via giveaways at school and encourage healthier lifestyles. Kraft, based in Northfield, Ill., said it would offer a broad range of portion-size choices, including snacks in small packages. It will give nutrition information for entire packages, rather than just for individual portions.
